result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Michael Rix was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Jason Michael Rix not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 4.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Robert R or his residence.

Defendant Jason Michael Rix in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Jason Michael Rix in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
